meanings.meaning_en_US: To choose one option or preference over another.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 選擇某個選項或偏好

examples.sentence: I think I will [opt for] the vegetarian meal.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我想我會選擇素食餐。

examples.sentence: They decided to [opt for] a more expensive hotel.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們決定選擇一家更貴的酒店。

examples.sentence: When in doubt, I usually [opt for] what's familiar.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在困惑時，我通常選擇熟悉的。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To decide not to participate in something.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 決定不參加某事

examples.sentence: You can [opt out] of the mailing list at any time.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 你可以隨時選擇退出郵件列表。

examples.sentence: I chose to [opt out] of the survey.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我選擇退出調查。

examples.sentence: She decided to [opt out] of the group project.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她決定不參與小組項目。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To include a lot of activities or information in a limited amount of time.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 在有限的時間內包含很多活動或信息

examples.sentence: We really [packed in] a lot during our short trip.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我們在短短的旅行中確實包含了很多活動。

examples.sentence: She tried to [pack in] as many meetings as possible.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她試圖安排盡可能多的會議。

examples.sentence: They [packed in] several workshops during the conference.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們在會議期間安排了幾個研討會。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To put things into a container or bag for storage or transport.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 將物品放入容器或包中以便存儲或運輸

examples.sentence: It's time to [pack up] after the party.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 派對結束後，是時候收拾了。

examples.sentence: She needs to [pack up] her belongings before moving.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她需要在搬家前整理好自己的物品。

examples.sentence: They [packed up] the supplies to take to the event.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們將物資整理好以帶到活動中。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To move past something or someone.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 經過某物或某人

examples.sentence: We saw them [pass by] the park while walking.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我們在散步時看到他們經過公園。

examples.sentence: They didn't notice us [passing by] the café.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們沒有注意到我們經過咖啡館。

examples.sentence: You can see the river as you [pass by].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 你經過時能看到河流。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To refuse or decline something; to transmit information.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 拒絕某事或傳遞信息

examples.sentence: He decided to [pass on] the job offer.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他決定拒絕這個工作機會。

examples.sentence: Please [pass on] my regards to your family.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 請代我向你的家人問好。

examples.sentence: She always tries to [pass on] useful tips.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她總是試圖傳遞有用的建議。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To give money in exchange for something.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 用金錢交換某物

examples.sentence: I will [pay for] the dinner tonight.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 今晚我將支付晚餐的費用。

examples.sentence: She forgot to [pay for] her coffee.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她忘了付咖啡的費用。

examples.sentence: They need to [pay for] their tickets in advance.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們需要提前支付票款。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To finish paying a debt or to receive a benefit from an investment.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 還清債務或從投資中獲得利益

examples.sentence: He finally [paid off] his student loans.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他最終還清了學生貸款。

examples.sentence: The investment really [paid off] in the long run.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這項投資在長期內獲得了回報。

examples.sentence: She hopes her hard work will [pay off] soon.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她希望自己的努力能儘快有回報。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To distribute or disburse money.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 分配或支付金錢

examples.sentence: The insurance company will [pay out] for the damages.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 保險公司將支付損失的賠償金。

examples.sentence: They plan to [pay out] bonuses at the end of the year.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們計劃在年底發放獎金。

examples.sentence: You can [pay out] compensation for the inconvenience.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 您可以支付因不便而產生的賠償金。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To eat something slowly or in small bites; to annoy or criticize someone.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 慢慢吃東西或小口吃；煩擾或批評某人

examples.sentence: He tends to [pick at] his food when he's not hungry.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 當他不餓時，他會慢慢吃東西。

examples.sentence: She [picked at] the leftovers instead of eating a full meal.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她只吃了剩菜，而不是吃一頓完整的餐。

examples.sentence: Don't [pick at] him; he's doing his best.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 不要挑剔他；他已經在努力了。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To bully or unfairly criticize someone.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 欺負或不公平地批評某人

examples.sentence: It's not nice to [pick on] others for their mistakes.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 因為別人的錯誤而挑剔他人並不好。

examples.sentence: He always [picks on] his little brother.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他總是欺負他的小弟弟。

examples.sentence: Don't [pick on] her; she is trying her best.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 不要欺負她；她已經在努力了。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To lift something or someone; to improve or increase.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 拾起某物或某人；改善或增加

examples.sentence: Can you [pick up] that book from the floor?
examples.translation_zh_TW: 你能從地上撿起那本書嗎？

examples.sentence: Sales have started to [pick up] after the holiday season.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 節假日之後，銷售開始回升。

examples.sentence: We need to [pick up] the pace to finish on time.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我們需要加快進度以便按時完成。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To accumulate or stack things together.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 將東西累積或堆疊在一起

examples.sentence: The work has started to [pile up] since I've been gone.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 自從我離開以來，工作開始累積。

examples.sentence: We need to [pile up] the boxes for the move.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我們需要把箱子堆起來以供搬運。

examples.sentence: She let her laundry [pile up] before doing it.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在洗衣之前，她讓衣物積累起來。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To suddenly appear or come out; to leave briefly.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 突然出現或走出；短暫離開

examples.sentence: He [popped out] to buy some groceries.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他出門買了一些雜貨。

examples.sentence: Suddenly, a rabbit [popped out] from behind the bush.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 突然，一隻兔子從灌木叢後面跳了出來。

examples.sentence: She [popped out] to say hello and then came back.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她出來打招呼，然後又回來了。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To arrive at a certain place, often in reference to transportation.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 到達某地，通常是指交通工具

examples.sentence: The train will [pull in] at 5 PM.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 火車將於下午5點抵達。

examples.sentence: The bus [pulled in] right on time.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 公車準時到達。

examples.sentence: They can [pull in] several passengers at once.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們可以一次接載幾個乘客。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To come to a stop after driving.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 駕駛後停下來

examples.sentence: Please [pull up] to the curb.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 請停到路邊。

examples.sentence: He [pulled up] right outside the entrance.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他就在入口處停下來。

examples.sentence: The driver [pulled up] and let passengers out.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 駕駛員停下並讓乘客下車。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To continue moving forward or making progress.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 繼續前進或取得進展

examples.sentence: Even though it was tough, they decided to [push on].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 儘管很艱難，他們決定繼續前進。

examples.sentence: Let's [push on] despite the obstacles.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 儘管有困難，我們還是繼續前進吧。

examples.sentence: They have to [push on] to meet the deadline.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們必須繼續努力以趕上最後期限。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To delay something or postpone it.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 延遲或推遲某事

examples.sentence: We had to [put off] the meeting until next week.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我們不得不將會議推遲到下週。

examples.sentence: She decided to [put off] her vacation plans.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她決定推遲她的度假計劃。

examples.sentence: Don't [put off] your homework; you'll regret it later.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 不要拖延你的家庭作業；你會為此後悔。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To extinguish a fire or to produce something.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 撲滅火源或生產某物

examples.sentence: The firefighters [put out] the blaze quickly.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 消防員迅速撲滅了大火。

examples.sentence: Can you [put out] the candles when you're done?
examples.translation_zh_TW: 你能在結束時熄滅蠟燭嗎？

examples.sentence: The company is planning to [put out] a new product.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 該公司計劃推出一款新產品。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To increase or improve something, usually in preparation for something.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 增加或改善某物，通常是為了準備某事

examples.sentence: We need to [ramp up] production for the holiday season.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我們需要增加生產來迎接假日季節。

examples.sentence: The team is planning to [ramp up] their marketing efforts.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 該團隊計劃加強他們的市場行銷工作。

examples.sentence: They need to [ramp up] training sessions for new hires.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們需要增加新員工的培訓課程。
